entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a student who is concerned about his owl Hedwig's well-being. He mentions that he doesn't know what Thestrals are but wants to know if Hedwig will be okay.

entities.name: hedwig
entities.description: Hedwig is Harry's owl who has traveled a long distance and needs rest. Professor McGonagall and Professor Grubbly-Plank examine her wing to determine the extent of her injuries.

entities.name: professor mcgonagall
entities.description: Professor McGonagall is a teacher who looks at Harry sharply and understands that 'London' refers to 'number twelve, Grimmauld Place'. She examines Hedwig's wing with Professor Grubbly-Plank.

entities.name: professor grubbly-plank
entities.description: Professor Grubbly-Plank is a teacher who pulls out a monocle to examine Hedwig's wing closely. She offers to take care of Hedwig and suggests that she shouldn't fly long distances for a few days.

entities.name: thestrals
entities.description: Thestrals are creatures that Harry doesn't know about but is curious about. Professor McGonagall seems to understand what they are.

entities.name: grimmauld place
entities.description: Grimmauld Place is a location in London where Harry lives with his relatives. Professor McGonagall understands that 'London' refers to this address.

relationships.description: Professor McGonagall understands what Harry means by 'London', which actually refers to Grimmauld Place.
Professor Grubbly-Plank offers to take care of Hedwig and suggests that she shouldn't fly long distances for a few days.
Professor McGonagall examines Hedwig's wing with Professor Grubbly-Plank to determine the extent of her injuries.
